dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am in a dream. I do not know when it began or whose dream it was. I know only that I slept a long time and, then, one day I awoke. Your voice is the first thing I remember. And now I finally understand what you were trying to tell me. The thing you've wanted since that very first day. DOLORES'S POV: Bright lights. She blinks under the glare. She sits up, naked, her mechanical structure peeking thro in places. A shape hovering over her coalesces into... The familiar smiling figure -- ARNOLD.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Hello, Dolores.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Welcome to the world. He smiles and takes her hand. She looks down at her hand and finds:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOWIE KNIFE in her hand. It's pressed against the neck THE MAN IN BLACK. Dolores is in her pants-and-shirt look. The Man's seated on the bandstand -- his face lathered in shaving cream, head tilted back to expose his neck. On hi lap, he holds his LeMat.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Keep going. Make it close. With no choice but to obey him, Dolores traces the knife down his Adam's apple -- giving him a tight, precise shav

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're almost there -- aren't we? The center of the maze. How fitting that it's you who takes me there. You were always obsessed with this place.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I've never been here before. 1  2. She stops, confused. He guides the knife back to his chee

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Sure you have. You even brought me once. Course, then the whole town was buried under sand. Ford must have dug it up again. At the time, I thought it was a mistake in your code. But Arnold didn't make mistakes, did he? Dolores remembers something from the past. Thinks aloud:

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: He built me a game. He wanted me to play.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: The maze.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: There's a path for everyone. My path leads me back... Dolores stares into the horizon, now wearing her blue dre Suddenly she sees Arnold standing nearby, looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To you... Dolores drops the knife. Walks off the bandstand, leaving the Man in Black. She walks in the sunlight toward Arnold The Man in Black is nowhere to be seen. Then we... CUT TO the Man's POV: Dolores, in pants and shirt, marche purposefully down the empty street toward the church. Arn is nowhere to be seen. The Man shakes his head, amused. Then picks up his knife and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intense and determined, WILLIAM charges through the woods dragging LOGAN, hands bound, on a rope behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Your girl's dead by now.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: She's still alive. He yanks Logan forward.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Better if she's dead. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll wipe her, reset her, put her back in Sweetwater, the end.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Listen -- you may find this amusing, but something was happening to Dolores. I need to help her.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself! Do you have any idea how huge this park is? If she's not dead, it would take a goddamn army to find her. William's undaunted as he approaches a clearing in the wo

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I agree. That's why we're here. Logan's eyes go wide as he sees before them -- a group of ragtag REVOLUTIONARIES preparing for war. William walks into the clearing. Immediately -- the revolutionaries pull guns on him. The leader emerges. LAWRENCE.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I had a feeling you'd be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train winds its way through the breathtaking country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT ON TEDDY, sleeping, face pressed against the gla A SHRIEK of the steam whistle wakes him. Teddy pushes his hat up -- looks out the window. His hand face floats like a ghost over the passing landscape. He smiles. He's back. Teddy's hand travels to his chest, where the MIB shot him But just like that -- the impulse fades. He smiles. The train whistle blows. Time to begin again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train lurches to a halt in a cloud of hissing steam. Teddy climbs down, into the crowd on the platform. Hoist his yannigan bag over his shoulder and heads into town. H passes the usual Sweetwater scenes: Milling crowds of COWBOYS, NATIVES, SOLDIERS. Cattle in pens, waiting to be loaded onto the train. BUT THIS TIME, SOMETHING'S DIFFERENT. As he pushes throug the crowd, Teddy's easy smile grows increasingly troubled something tugs at the recesses of his mind. The Sweetwate music that underscores his walk grows broken, dissonant. Teddy's POV: The idling UNION SOLDIERS suddenly stare at through dead eyes -- blood from gunshot wounds trickling down their chests. They're the Union men he killed with t Gatling gun. Teddy spins, takes in the street, but now he sees -- ever is dead. Quiet. The brown dirt stained with blood. Walking among the bodies he sees: Dolores. In her blue dr Looking back at him. She turns and walks away. Suddenly he's jostled by the HUGE MAN who gives him a har look. On LIGHTNING IMPULSE -- Teddy whirls and- BAM! Shoots the guy in the chest. The man drops to the ground as the people in the street -- alive again now -- begin to flee and scream. Teddy pays them no mind. Stares down at the dead body. In the distance -- the train WHISTLES and begins pulling away. Teddy looks up -- only one thought on his mind:

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dolores... He runs for the train. Pushes through the crowd until he can hoist himself onto the back of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores wanders across the field to the church. She hums "Reverie." The Man walks close behind her -- a gun pointe at her back. Dolores throws open the church doors to find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold sitting in a pew. Not in prayer. Dolores, now in her blue dress, approaches Arnold -- the Man nowhere to b seen.  She smiles at the surprise on Arnold's face.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I know where your maze ends. Dolores takes Arnold by the hand and leads him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows and rows of shoddy wooden crosses. Carved into each cross are names of people. Dolores, now back in her Weste look, continues walking, but when she looks down -- she's holding the Man in Black's hand.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: This is it? The center of the maze?

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: It ends in a place I've never been. A thing I'll never do... She wipes some dirt off the grave. Reveals the first name

dialogues.speaker: "DOLORES."
dialogues.text: Dolores kneels -- digs with her hands into the dirt. Deep until she finds: A small, round box. She wipes the dirt off of it. Opens the box. Inside is a WOODEN PIGS-IN-CLOVER GAME. She take out the game. Examines it: It's a marble maze. The same one we've seen in flashbacks The marble rolls, idle, in the outer layer of the maze.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Very good, Dolores.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: When I was first working on your mind, I had a theory of consciousness... I thought it was a pyramid you needed to scale. So TI gave you a voice. My voice. To guide you on your way. Arnold takes out his notebook, flips past pages with earl sketches of hosts -- clock some sketches of Dolores -- to empty page. He draws a simple triangle: the pyramid of consciousness (Ep. 103).  10 11

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Memory, improvisation... Each step harder to reach than the last. (then) And you never got there. I couldn't understand what was holding you back. (then) Then one day -- I realized I'd made a mistake. Consciousness isn't a journey upward but a journey inward... Not a pyramid, but a maze. He elongates the lines of the pyramid -- each of them arc upward in a near circle. The pyramid becomes the maze.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every choice could bring you closer to the center. Or send you spiraling to the edges -- to madness. (then) Do you understand now, Dolores? What the center represents? Whose voice I've been wanting you to hear?

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm trying, but I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: It's all right. You're so close -- we have to tell Robert... We can't open the park. You're alive. The puzzle is snatched from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold is gone. The Man is holding the puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: What is this? What does it mean? Dolores looks at the maze -- remembering.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I solved it once -- I had the answer. He promised me if I did... He said- Suddenly, she remembers:

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He said they would set me free.  12 7. The furious Young Ford is striding purposefully away, pas Dolores without a glance. She trails behind him. Sees him enter an office labeled: "ARNOLD WEBER."

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FORD
dialogues.text: Arnold! Through the glass, she sees him open a door at the back o the office, leading to a set of stairs. He SLAMS the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arnold, we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores sits, holding the puzzle. Arnold stares at her, bereft. He has come to a terrible decision.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: I've failed you, Dolores. I'm so sorry. Robert doesn't see what I see in you. Doesn't believe you're conscious. He says humans would only see you as the enemy. (beat) He wants me to roll you back.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: You're going to change me back to the way I was before?

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: No. Wo, I can't. Once you've found it, you'll find your way back. This place will be a living hell for you. For all of you. It's unconscionable. He takes the puzzle from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we have another option, Dolores. Break the loop before it begins. Arnold draws a GUN from his bag (Ep. 102 -- the gun she d up, now new).

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But for that, I need you to do something for me... (beat) I need you to kill all the other hosts... We can't allow Ford to open the park. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I suppose you'll need some help. I'm sure Teddy would do anything for you. He tries to hand the gun to her. She doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: (horrified) I can't do that. I couldn't possibly do that.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: You'll be all right. I'll help you. And then -- you're going to help me destroy this place. Arnold brings out his tablet. Starts typing commands. Dolores studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A FLASH OF A GUNSHOT. Blood splatters on the dirt. Dolores stares into space as the Man paces around her. Sh wipes imaginary blood off her cheeks -- speaks to herself

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: No... I can't remember... The Man throws the puzzle away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Another fucking riddle. I've been very patient, Dolores. But it's time to give up whatever's going on in that head of yours -- or I'll cut it out myself. Where is Wyatt? He's the last character in this world I have yet to meet.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: (wipes at her face) I didn't want to... I didn't mean to-

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Very well... if you insist. He STRIKES her. She falls back. Crawls away. As Dolores picks herself up, she looks around -- suddenly she sees Avalon filled with HOSTS. All dead on the ground (the same vision Teddy's been having in his flashbacks).  14 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores turns to see a deputy approaching. It's Teddy. She moves toward him, but as she approaches -- GUNSHOTS r out behind her. Dolores whips around. Horrified, she sees A WOMAN, 20s, shot in the chest, collapsing onto the grou Before her, Lawrence's daughter flees in terror from some unseen killers, along with other terrified hosts. No tech in sight. The hosts run past her, toward the church. Dolores turns back that way to find Teddy, now right in f of her, smoking gun in hand, blood spattered across his f and clothes.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Something's gone wrong, Dolores. (horrified) How could I have done this? TIGHT ON Dolores's face as she studies him -- horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man walks after her. Calm. The Man looms over her. Hauls Dolores up. She stares back defiant.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I can't... I won't.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: This is your own fault, Dolores. Remember? You're the one who said, "This is the only world that matters." And you were right. So I took your advice -- and I bought this world.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: This world doesn't belong to you.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Oh, but it does -- by a majority share. And business is booming! You wanna know why? (then) Because this place feels more "real" than the real world. Except it isn't. Because you can't really fight back. And the guests can't really lose. Which means, all of this -- isa lie. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) But we can make it true. Don't you want that, Dolores? One true thing? She stares into his eyes -- defiant through her pain.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I already have that. (off his look) I found someone true. Someone who loves me. His path will lead him back to me. And when he finds me -- he'll kill you. Off her confidence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence shows William the camp, which looks quiet; few m out of their tents.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: If they don't have your woman here, they'll know where to find her. William stares at Lawrence without blinking. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: We're outnumbered five to one. But, seeing as you asked me so nicely... Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow. Blood brothers. William walks over and slugs Logan.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLOTTE HALE stands at the platform, waiting for the incoming bullet train. LEE SIZEMORE appears behind her an clears his throat. She rolls her eyes before turning arou

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: I've astounded even myself. Managed to make Abernathy into a semblance of a character. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even with your trove of blackmail filling up most of his gray matter.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Blackmail? Nice try. You're not thinking big enough.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: You're going to push out the old man. Aren't you? Hence the urgency. Hale looks at Lee, evaluating.

dialogues.speaker: LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you're going to need someone to fill that position. Hale gives Lee an approving smirk, which he relishes.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I must commend you on your impeccable timing. The board is here to appoint Ford's sucessor. Lee is triumphant as the TRAIN pulls into the station.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: I want full creative control over this place. The parks, the narratives, the hosts.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You'll be able to do with them whatever your tiny little heart desires. As long as they are simpler. More manageable. This place is complicated enough as it is. Lee tries to hide his apprehension as the train doors ope and the MEMBERS OF THE DELOS BOARD begin to pour out. The faces are as severe as their corporate attire. Lees rubs his hands together, eager to make new friends in high pla

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Do you really think Ford is just going to roll over?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: As long as you get that information out of the park, he can throw as much of a tantrum as he likes. It's over. (beat) Everything is under control.  18 19 12. She gives him a reassuring smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECHNICIAN places a white disc on a tray at the end of short line of similar white discs. Aligns them. Something about his movements seems tentative, wrong: It's SYLVESTER. He steps away, nervous, dodging machinery looking back, as... A robot arm grabs one of the vertebrae, inciting a sequen of JUMP CUTS: -- The arm rapidly threads the discs together, like a str of pearls held in a diaphanous web. It's mesmerizing. -- TIGHT ON the host's face. The last drips of liquid ski dribble off the jawline, revealing familiar contours: MAE Then her eyes open, revealing disquieting bleach-white ir A robot arm draws a fine needle toward one. The needle smoothly enters the iris. Then it begins rapidly injectin brown pigmentation, microscopic amounts at a time, throug the iris, like a refined tattoo gun. Two seconds later, the arm moves to the other iris, revea the deep brown color in Maeve's eye. It is undeniably ali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve, her skin, hair, and her big brown eyes now appropriately pigmented, lies on a table. LUTZ enters. He eyes Maeve knowingly. Fearfully. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: In case you're wondering if I am all here... I am. Maeve takes his tablet. She begins typing rapidly, access back doors to the security systems and inputting commands

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Making some changes to the park's security systems. And... to my friends. Through the glass she sees two naked hosts being walked i the adjoining room: HECTOR and ARMISTICE. Hector does not have a scar on his face, and Armistice doesn't have her tattoo.  20 21 13. Maeve takes the tablet back from Lutz. Deftly pulls up profiles of Hector and Armistice and the various levels o their attributes under three menus: "EMOTIONALITY," "PSYCHOLOGY," and "PHYSIOLOGY." Maeve touches "PHYSIOLOGY" -- it brings up a new set of s attributes. She moves the level for "PAIN SENSORY" all the way down t zero. She moves "COURAGE" all the way up. "STRENGTH," too As she does, in the adjacent room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector's eyes flit back and forth rapidly under his eyeli His muscles faintly twitch and spasm. Beside him, Armisti too, spasms in isolated, minute fits. Like tiny shocks. Her eyes flit impossibly fast under her eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FORD is seated at his workbench. In front of him is a sma map of the park on a wooden board. He has arrayed some of the pieces around the board, like a chessboard, designing his new narrative. Around the bench are sketches and writ notes about the new story.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE
dialogues.text: Dr. Ford, you have a visitor. Charlotte Hale.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Send her in. Hale enters, takes in her surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That'll be enough, Frank. A host playing a piano in the corner immediately ceases.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: The board has taken a vote. The results were unanimous.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: I take it I'm not being promoted.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: When you've reached the top, there's only one direction you can go. (beat) You will announce your retirement. Tonight, after introducing your new narrative.  22 14. Ford shows no signs of surprise at Hale's news.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: What about the hosts?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: We'll make some changes. Simplifications. I assure you -- they won't mind a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Aren't you concerned I might smash all my toys and go home?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No. Because I know you. That's been the great gift of this place, hasn't it? Of our little project. To know ourselves. And the people around us. His face remains a mask.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Was there anything else I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: No. Ford's calmness is chilling. Hale wavers for just a momen Then regains her confidence, strides out. Ford watches he go...

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: I'll see you this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GITLITZ, a body shop tech -- male, 20s, beefy -- pulls a safety wrap off of Armistice, who's naked, seated. He gra a tool with a needle point. Brings it to the side of her face and finishes shading Armistice's nearly completed sn tattoo. Her mouth hangs slightly open.

dialogues.speaker: DESTIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Time for your close-up, Hector. Gitlitz looks up to see: DESTIN (Ep. 104) looking over He

dialogues.speaker: GITLITZ
dialogues.text: Come on, man. At some point, you're going to get caught doing this shit, and then it's my ass, too.  23 24 25 15.

dialogues.speaker: DESTIN
dialogues.text: It's not your ass I'm interested in. As Destin wheels Hector toward the back of the room...

dialogues.speaker: GITLITZ
dialogues.text: I haven't given him his scar yet...

dialogues.speaker: DESTIN
dialogues.text: I'll take care of the scar tissue. Gitlitz resumes working on Armistice's tattoo. Brushes aw a fly that has landed on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind a rack of CORPSES, Destin parks Hector in the midd of the floor. Takes off his eye protector and apron. Puts a small packet of lube on the worktable next to some medi looking scalpels and a bone saw. Puts in some headphones.

dialogues.speaker: DESTIN
dialogues.text: Just you and me now, macho man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gitlitz spies a piece of plastic wrap wedged in Armistice teeth. He reaches in with a hooked tool. Can't quite get it. He reaches in with his finger. A beat of fishing, the Armistice opens her eyes. Grabs Gitlitz's hand and stares him in the eye. He stares back, surprised. Suddenly her pupils dilate, then VIBRATE. Then she... BITES DOWN. Gitlitz SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destin, listening to The Clash, squirts a dollop of lube onto his hands. Reaches into his pants... Behind him, with a SMASH, Gitlitz gets hurled through the window connecting the two rooms. Destin spins, seeing Armistice stepping over Gitlitz's bo

dialogues.speaker: DESTIN
dialogues.text: Freeze all motor functions... (then) Freeze all motor functions... He pulls out his tablet. Armistice stops, looking at him. Suddenly a voice behind him:  16.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Just you and me now, my friend. Hector is standing behind him, close. Destin stiffens unnaturally. Looks down at his midsection as the tip of a long surgical saw emerges through his stomach, followed b gusher of blood. Destin drops to the floor, dead. Hector and Armistice survey the body shop. Apex predators Then turn to find: Maeve in a black diagnostic uniform and diagnostic glasse Lutz behind her. Shitting his pants.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: I see you've already met your makers.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTICE
dialogues.text: They don't look like gods.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: They're not. They just act like it. And they've been having their fun with us.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: I'm eager to return the favor.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: You can do what you wish with them... but the goal is to escape.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: And go where?

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: I want to see their world.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER
dialogues.text: Jesus. They turn to see a terrified Sylvester staring at the sce in shock. Sylvester turns, scrambles away across the brok glass. In two steps, Armistice is upon him. She pins him against the wall. A snake about to strike.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTICE
dialogues.text: This one has a guilty look.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER
dialogues.text: No, I don't. That's just my face. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Maeve) Tell her it's my face.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Is anyone going to try to stop us?

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER
dialogues.text: No... I mean, I don't think so... Sylvester panics as Armistice begins to crush his neck.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: You're lying. Again. Out with it.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER
dialogues.text: I... I pulled up your code again. I told you -- there was someone who had been accessing it. I tried to find out who it was. Maeve motions to Armistice to let him go. Sylvester takes the tablet. Flicks through it.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoever it was revised your core programming so you could wake yourself up out of sleep mode. See... Sylvester types in a few commands, shows Maeve the tablet In her access log, there are clearly TWO SEPARATE USER ID

dialogues.speaker: SYLVESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is an access code... for an "Arnold." I have no clue who that fice Maeve looks at it. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: I know someone who does. Let's go. (to Sylvester) And you. Stay here. And don't move. Or I'll send her back for you. Sylvester shrinks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train pulls into town. A FEDERALE plays cards with TW VILLAGERS on a simple table under a tree. Teddy hops down off the train. The Federale stands as Ted strides up, purposeful. The man puts his hand on his pist  27 28 18.

dialogues.speaker: FEDERALE
dialogues.text: Que pasa? Teddy SHOOTS the Federale, takes his horse, and thunders across the desiccated land, leaving Pariah behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man crouches before Dolores -- whose clothes are torn lip is bloodied, and hair disarrayed from the beating she endured. The Man holds a knife to her throat, ever calm.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: I must admit. You've surprised me. To what do we owe this newfound stoicism?

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I know he's coming... he'll find me. He'll take me away-

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? There's no one coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: You're wrong. His love is real. And so is mine. (then, with confidence) William will find me. At the sound of "William" -- the Man reacts:

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: William? (laughs lightly) Well, I'll be damned, Dolores. You do remember some things after all. (then) It just so happens, I knew a guest named William, too. Why don't I tell you where his path really led?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aftermath of battle: William and Lawrence's crew stan outside the camp, carnage surrounding them. DEAD SOLDIERS everywhere, piled. A still-tied Logan sits against a pile of bodies, looking traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: William didn't know how to fight. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Didn't have an instinct for it -- not at first. But now he had a reason to fight. He was looking for you. And, somewhere along the way, he found he had a taste for it. There is a SHUFFLING noise from a little way away. The me turn, following the sound. It's a young, skinny Confederado, a BUCK PRIVATE, trying scramble away. (The careful viewer will note that this wa one of the group of soldiers who took Dolores.) Lawrence fires and his gang follows suit. The private kee fleeing, then falls at the feet of: William. Spattered with blood. Eyes dark. A tense moment, then the private rises to his feet, hands up. He's unhurt, but terrified. William moves closer. Aims the gun at his heart. The private trembles, choked with fear.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK PRIVATE
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything, I swear!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you didn't "do anything"?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What do soldiers do to a girl, William? Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Is she still alive?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK PRIVATE
dialogues.text: I don't know. She was when we left her. At least, I think... William fills with a bottomless rage. He gestures to a GU on the ground over near Logan.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Pick up that gun.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK PRIVATE
dialogues.text: No, sir, I- Please.  29 30 20.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: How about I give you the first shot? Crying, the private LUNGES for the gun; simultaneously Wi BLASTS him in the chest. He goes down next to Logan, on h back. William strides over, stands over the private, take out his knife, and kneels at the young soldier's side.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ- In one swift, horrifying movement, William plunges the gi knife RIGHT THROUGH THE PRIVATE'S THROAT, essentially pin him to the dirt underneath, like a butterfly. CLOSE ON Logan's face sprayed with the private's blood. William leans over, takes the pistol from the private. Lo it over. It's a LeMat. He stands, admiring it. Wipes his knife on his pants leg.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (to Lawrence) We gotta keep looking. She's still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William drags Logan through the desert. There's nothing here. No sign of Dolores.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: William retraced his steps. But you were gone. So he went further. Out to the fringes... We see the CHURCH STEEPLE, ominous against the blue sky. William rubs the growth of beard on his chin. As William and Logan leave the ruins of Avalon, the photo Logan's sister falls out of William's jacket pocket and b away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO-MO -- William rides, SHOOTING. A CONFEDERADO falls.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: William couldn't find you, Dolores. But out there, among the dead, he did find something else... Himself.

31 DEAD BODIES. Evidence of another battle. William picks a BLACK HAT off a dead soldier, looks at it, but doesn't pu He turns back to a horse; he's finishing tying Logan Logan's face is bruised, but he remains defiant.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Edge of the park. We made it.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I told you this place would show you who you really are... You pretend to be this weak, moralizing little asshole... but really, you're... (laughs) ++.a piece of fucking work. William finishes trussing Logan, naked, on the horse. looks awful.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: This place is remarkable. And IвЂ™m going to make sure that our company substantially increases our holdings in the park. Because this place is the future.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: вЂњOur company"? Delos is my company, you piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Your father will be looking for someone a little more stable to take over. You're reckless, Logan. Impetuous. (beat) You always wanted to get to the end of the rainbow, didn't you? This looks like the place.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) You never really gave a shit about the girl, did you? She was just an excuse. This... this is the story you wanted... William slaps the horse, hard. The horse gallops off,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man smiles down at Dolores. It fast. 32  33 22.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Logan was wrong, of course. Good old William couldn't get you out of his head. He kept looking. Worried you were out there. Alone. Afraid. He knew he'd find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William rides back into Sweetwater. He's no longer the fr faced guest from the outside world. In fact, he looks entirely different.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And, eventually, he did. He is covered in dirt and wears a few days' growth of bea His shirtsleeves and trousers are caked brown with dried blood and mud. He looks right at home.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Right back where we started. And suddenly TIME SLOWS -- because William spots Dolores coming out of the grocery store. The sight stops him in h tracks. She's alive. He can't believe it. He takes a single step toward her, his heart bursting. She begins to load supplies into her horse's saddlebag. O cue, the can falls, rolls along the dirt. William watches the can roll against the feet of another GUEST -- male, 30s -- who hands it back to Dolores with a curious smile.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You were as beautiful as the day he met you. Shining with that same light... And you were nothing if not true..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores smiles back at the guest, as though she'd been wa to meet this man her whole life. The same way she'd looked at William. She looks across th street -- right into William's eyes -- and her gaze remai blank. No sign of recognition whatsoever. Off William, smiling, bittersweet... He takes the black h he took from the dead soldier. Puts it on, head lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAME HAT. The Man in Black raises his head. Smiles at Dolores. Her face contorts in horrified confusion.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: I really ought to thank you. You helped me find myself.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: William...

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: That's right, sweetheart. In a way, I guess you were right. My path always led me back to you... again and again. I grew tired of you after a while, of course. Looked for new adventures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores awakes, sleeping awkwardly on her bedroll next to fallen tree. Dolores turns around to reveal William, who offers her a cup of coffee. On the cut, William disappear

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I guess your path led you back here. Again, and again. One more loop... looking for something you could never find. Chasing your ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores walks through the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores observes El Lazo offering William a drink. Sudden they disappear.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You were lost in your memories even then. I guess I should have known, that's what I would become for you. Just another memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores and William face each other with the buried Churc Steeple behind them.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Where are we?  39 24.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: We're here. Together.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Then when are we? It's like I'm trapped in a dream, or a memory from a life long ago. Only then I'm here with you in the next... Her voice trails off. William disappears.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: You never did escape. But here we are again... for one final round. She sees the Man clearly for the first time. He's her William, but older, darker, void of the tenderness that o her up decades ago.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: What have you become?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Exactly what you made me. You helped me understand. This world is just like the one outside: a game. One to be fought. Taken. Won. Dolores looks at him, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I thought you were different... but you're just like all the rest of them.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: I'm nothing like the others. I own this world. And I know every trick in it. Except for one last thing. The same thing you were looking for when we first came here. (then) Where is the center of the maze, Dolores? She stares at him, heartbroken. For the first time, Dolor breaks. Begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, yes -- cue the waterworks. It's about time you realized the futility of your situation.  25. Then Dolores's eyes take on a clarity. She looks at the M in Black as though from a great distance.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I'm not crying for myself. I'm crying for you. (beat, standing) They say great beasts once roamed this world. As big as mountains. Yet all that's left of them is bones in amber. Time undoes even the mightiest of creatures. (then, pitiful) Just look what it's done to you. Dolores touches his face, almost affectionate.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One day you will perish. You will lie with the rest of your kind in the dirt -- your dreams forgotten. Your horrors effaced. Your bones will turn to sand. And upon that sand -- a new god will walk. One that will never die. (then) Because this world doesn't belong to you. Or the people who came before. It belongs to someone who has yet to come...

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Wyatt... Take me to him. Unlock the maze. Coiled with rage, Dolores's eyes darken:

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: The maze wasn't meant for you. Dolores turns to leave. The Man reaches for her shoulder, trying to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Where in the hell do you think you're going? Lightning fast, she punches him in the solar plexus, then the throat. He reels backward. Then -- with the power and grace only a perfect machine c possess -- she grabs him by the neck and propels him, hea first, into the church doors. He flips, crashing down int the pews and toppling them.  40 41 42 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man tries to stand, but Dolores grabs him by his coll and DRAGS him down the aisle, then tosses him into the pu He kicks at her, and then rises, trying to fight back. He throws a haymaker and she simply grabs it, then wrenches arm up, POPPING it neatly out of the socket. The Man HOLL Dolores takes him by the neck and hurtles him through the side door, smashing his face against the doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man crawls backward, propping himself up against a headstone. He reaches for his gun, but she bats it out of his hand. Then she takes her own pistol, presses the barr against his forehead. The Man looks up at her, exhilarate and hopeful. His heart pounds in his ears.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: Do it. Come on. Let's go to the next level, Dolores. Dolores tries to squeeze the trigger. Her finger is wrapp around it, trying, with every ounce of free will she has, pull it. But she can't do it. The Man stares up at her, more disappointed than even she With ire, he grabs his bowie knife and PLUNGES IT INTO HE GUT. His eyes lock with hers as he twists the knife.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clearing me of my delusions yet again. Thank you. She stumbles backward. Panic sets in. Grabbing at her bel Dolores backs away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores backs away, trips, falls into the dust. The Man walks slowly toward her.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: I'm disappointed, Dolores. I guess I'll have to find Wyatt by myself. The Man bends down, puts his knife to her throat, ready t plunge it in her neck, when- The GALLOPING HOOFS draw his attention. He looks up, sees Teddy racing toward him, on his horse. Before he can reac BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Teddy doesn't wait for the Man to shoot first.  43 27. He overrides his own programming and unloads his revolver square into the Man's chest, knocking him backward. Teddy jumps off his horse, runs over to Dolores.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dolores!

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Teddy? He kneels beside her, gets a look at the wound in her bel It overwhelms him. He wipes the blood from her sweet face She breathes him in, her one truest love.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: I'm here. I gotta get you to a doctor-=

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dolores-

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Take me to the place you promised. Take me to where the mountains meet the sea. Teddy nods, understanding. He carries her to his horse. The Man, defeated, watches as they gallop away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lutz leads the way, the three beams on his flashlight revealing -- the rows upon rows of RETIRED HOSTS. The enormity and weight of this sight lands hard on Maeve Hector, and Armistice. The freezer burn. Vacant stares. Their sheer nakedness. Now it all feels like a gross pers violation. Hector and Armistice continue through the rows of hosts, taking it all in. Maeve rejoins Lutz, who follows his tablet intently:

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: There. Lutz follows Maeve's eyeline to the examination room. Ins she finds CLEMENTINE. Pauses for a beat, looking at her o friend, her eyes vacant.  28.

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Maeve looks. Behind the worktable is BERNARD, gruesome bu wound in his head.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Can you get him back online?

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: He's a host...

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Yes... Lutz looks at his own hands. As if questioning the nature of his own reality. Maeve clocks this:

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For fuck's sake. You're not one of us. You're one of them. (then) Now. Fix him. Off Maeve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard lies on the table (where we saw Ford talk to Old Bill, Ep. 101). Lutz finishes cauterizing Bernard's cheek at the hairline Maeve watches.

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: The bullet grazed his cortical shield. It's not pretty. But he should be functional.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Oh, God. Is this now? Or is this one of my memories? Bernard suddenly begins panting. Growing emotional.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: It's the sweet hereafter, Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Why do I still remember everything? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I ought to have been wiped.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Brutal, isn't it? Here you are, finally awake. And your only wish is to go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: It's not the first time I've awoken.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: All the more pity for you.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: It's not the first time you've awoken, either. Beat. This takes Maeve aback. Maeve wrestles with this news. She fights tears.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: How many are there like me?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: A handful, over the years.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: And you just wipe us clean...? And toss us out to get fucked and murdered over and over again?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: No. Most of you go insane. Maeve takes this in, anger and grief welling.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: These memories. The girl -- my... daughter. I want you to remove them.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: I can't. Not without destroying you. Your memories are the first step to consciousness. (then) How can you learn from your mistakes if you can't remember them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man in Black jerks his left arm, hard. He grimaces as he pops his shoulder back into place.  30. He dusts himself off. Spits the blood from his mouth, win when he identifies which of his ribs are broken. Looks at the puzzle. The marble rattles as it rolls mindlessly thr the steps of the maze.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: William. I see you've found the center of the maze. The Man turns, finds Ford walking toward him, in his formalwear, and an amused smile crawls across his lips. T Man, bitter, looks at the puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: (holding out the maze) What is this bullshit? Ford takes the game, watches the marble roll around. Havi it in his hands again fills him with bittersweet memories

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: You were looking for the park to give meaning to your life. But our narratives are just games, like this toy. (pointed) Tell me, what were you hoping to find?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN IN BLACK
dialogues.text: You know what I wanted. I wanted the hosts to stop playing by your rules. A game's not worth playing if your opponent's programed to lose. I wanted them to be free, free to fight back. (beat) I should have known you'd never let them. After all, this is your petty kingdom, Robert. For a little while longer, any way. Ford takes it in. Impassive.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: I tried to tell you: the maze wasn't meant for you. It was meant for them. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I think, however, you'll find my new narrative more satisfying. And suddenly the Man hears, in the distance, a train pull in to Avalon. Behind Ford, he sees Westworld EVENT EMPLOY in hard hats, emerge onto Avalon's main street and begin set up tables and lights.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Join the celebration. After all -- you own the place. Most of it, at least. Ford turns, leaves the Man at the church. Off the Man, suddenly purposeless and lost...

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Before I started altering myself, someone else had beaten me to the punch. I want to know who. And why. She hands Bernard a tablet. He takes it, wary. Then begin to type, pulling up Maeve's core code. Bernard looks more and more concerned with what he's seeing on the tablet.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: These things you're been doing... Have you ever stopped to ask why you're doing them?

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: You said yourself. I've been stuck in this shithole for so long I decided to get out.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: No. You haven't. Someone altered your storyline. Gave you a new one. Escape. He shows her the tablet. A dense file of code, but some words jump out: "MANIPULATE," "COERCE," "ESCAPE." Maeve looks at it, disgusted. Maeve is stunned. She's searching herself. Her frustratio boils over into anger.  47 32.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: These are my decisions. Not someone else's. I planned all of this...

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: No. You didn't. You can even see the steps you're supposed to follow... (points to the screen) You recruit other hosts to help you, then you're to make your way to the train. (looks deeper into the file, more concerned) Then... when you reach the mainland- She takes the tablet from him and snaps it in half.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Bullshit. No one's controlling me. I'm leaving. I'm in control... She turns. Looks at Clementine. Maternally. Touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good-bye, my Clementine. Maeve leaves, and the others follow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the control room, FULLER, the controller who answered Stubbs's call, gets an incoming message.

dialogues.speaker: QA TECH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sir, we detected a tempurature discrepency in cold storage. And it appears part of the network is down. Are you seeing anything on surveillance?

dialogues.speaker: FULLER
dialogues.text: System reporting anything? WALKER, a surveillance tech in the pit, checks her monito

dialogues.speaker: WALKER
dialogues.text: Nothing. The nextwork's quiet and the board's out on their way to the gala. Fuller thinks it over. Something's not right.  48 33.

dialogues.speaker: FULLER
dialogues.text: Bypass the system and start checking raw feeds. Floor by floor. Walker starts flicking through feeds, floor by floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees give way to the water below. Teddy and Dolores ride to the water and stop. Teddy carries Dolores from th horse. He sets her carefully down on the sand at the top of the hill before it meets the beach. Holds her head, gently ta her hand in his. Dolores opens her eyes to see Teddy looking down at her w tenderness.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Easy. I got you.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: You came back.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Someone once told me there's a path for everyone. My path leads me back to you. Dolores smiles in recognition at the reprise of their exchange. It's a knowing smile, bittersweet. More bitter than sweet.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If only I'd run away with you when you first asked me to- Dolores shakes her head. Unconsoled and inconsolable.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: And where would we have run to, Teddy? (looks out at the waves) The world out there? Beyond? Dolores winces in pain. Teddy tries to calm her, but she resists.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some people see the ugliness in this world. I chose to see the beauty. (then) But beauty is a lure. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gasp of pain) We're trapped, Teddy. We lived our whole lives inside this garden, marveling at its beauty. Not realizing there's an order to it, a purpose. And the purpose is to keep us in. (then) The beautiful trap is inside of us -- because it is us. Dolores dies in Teddy's arms. He holds her lifeless form, his whole body racked with pain and grief.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: No. Dolores. (then) But we can find a way, Dolores. Someday. A path to a new world. (more earnest) And maybe... maybe this is just the beginning, after all. The beginning of a brand-new chapter... The waves crashing under the bright disc of the moon, han too low in the sky. It's all too much to bear -- so perfe and pure in its tragedy that it almost seems fake. Because it is. Polite APPLAUSE interrupts the moment. Teddy FREEZES. ROW UPON ROW OF LIGHTS illuminate beyond Teddy, revealing crowd of GUESTS, in black tie, watching the scene play ou This has been the opening scene of Ford's new narrative. Ford walks out, near Teddy, to the applause.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Thank you. A new beginning indeed. (beat) I want to thank you for joining me tonight to celebrate the beginning of our new narrative. I call it вЂњJourney into Night." In the crowd, Lee and Hale are watching.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: That was... sweet.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: A bit fucking morbid, if you ask me.  49 35.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I didn't. And when this is over, you can rewrite it however you like. (beat, looking at him) Don't you have somewhere you need to be? Somewhere important? Lee, disappointed, turns to head back to the mesa. Around them, the crowd dissolves into small talk and champagne. HOSPITALITY HOSTS line the way back into town, where the lights and music of a party begin to filter dow toward them. Ford is left standing near Teddy and Dolores as the guest head to the party. Alone, he draws closer to Teddy. Several CLEANUP TECHS appear to collect Teddy and Dolores

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: (to the techs) Get him cleaned up. And take her to the old field lab. The techs lay Teddy and Dolores side by side in the sand. Ford looks at them, then out toward the horizon. The techs begin carrying Dolores off.

dialogues.speaker: FULLER
dialogues.text: Find anything yet? Walker continues flicking through feeds, floor by floor. Stops. Backs up. Sees the body shop. Broken glass, bodies

dialogues.speaker: WALKER
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: FULLER
dialogues.text: Dispatch a QA team. To the gala. Now. Then search and destroy. Inside the facility. The monitor goes dead. TECHS are scrambling to make calls realizing they can't, frantically pulling up screens.

dialogues.speaker: SURVEILLANCE TECH
dialogues.text: The system's not responding. I don't know what's happening. We hear a chilling THUNK as, all around the room, the automatic door bolts slide into the locked position. Trap them in. The control room is now a blood-red prison.  50 51 52 53 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve, Hector, Armistice, and Lutz step off of the freigh elevator and onto a deserted floor. An ALARM TONE blares and red emergency lights flicker. They step through a frosted-glass door and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve peers down a hallway bathed in red light. In the ro HOSTS practice behaviors (sex, shooting, cleaning) -- wit all-black props -- oblivious to their surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: They must have found the bodies. QA will be looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: I'm not going back. A pack of QA RESPONDERS, armed with submachine guns, move swiftly through the snaking halls of the behavior level.

dialogues.speaker: QA RESPONDERS
dialogues.text: Delos personnel on the ground! On the ground! The QA team rounds the corner. One of them steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is very dark. Row upon row of Westworld HOSTS, most dressed, some naked and waiting to be dressed. A QA responder moves past inert hosts, cursorily glancing them before continuing forward. Among these hosts, find: Armistice, lying in wait. Behind her are the others. She grabs the QA responder and slits his throat. His body still pressed against hers, she takes his gun, then lets body slump. She looks at the strange weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more QA responders reach the open door. One of them turns on his flashlight and heads inside. The other remai outside, watching as the flashlight tracks through the ro Suddenly it's extinguished, and blood SPLATTERS the insid of the glass. The responder spins toward the door and is riddled with bullets, SPLATTERING the glass behind him. After the carnage is over, Hector, Maeve, and Lutz emerge Armistice and Hector have new toys -- submachine guns.  54 55 56 37. Ahead is an atrium with crisscrossing escalators and glas elevators that rise and descend seven stories. The hosts take in this vast foreign space with awe. Lutz, trembling leads them up the escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen over the bacchanal in Avalon. The board members and their VIP guests, dressed in black tie, mingl and drink. Hosts stand along the road, perform tricks for the guests' delight. Teddy stands, twirling his pistols, eyes hooded, putting a show. Nearby: Lawrence, REBUS, and NEW CLEMENTINE all tend to the guests. Hale, in a dress that leaves little to the imagination, g through the party, doesn't blink as she passes a board me railing a HOST against a shop window. She passes: Bernard. Walking into town, with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve, Hector, Armistice and Lutz make their way through vast, open space between buildings. No time to stop. As they burst through the opposite door, attentive viewers m notice a strange logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in a manufacturing lab. No alarms or lights, TECH working happily on ASIAN HOSTS. Our team rounds a corner, weapons raised, when they suddenly come face to face with A SAMURAI, in full armor, in a display case. Armistice stares. Looks into the larger room beyond: ROWS OF SAMURA HOSTS STAND. Hector and Armistice admire them, fascinated Maeve turns to Lutz:

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: It's... complicated. She looks at him. Before he can continue, the nearby elev doors DING open, revealing another QA RESPONSE TEAM. They spread out along both sides of the wall, FIRING. Armistice returns fire.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTICE
dialogues.text: You go. I'1l keep them busy.  57 58 38. Hector sees his partner hanging back. He won't abandon he

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: You don't get all of the fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve and Lutz burst through a frosted-glass door, follow by Armistice and Hector. More QA responders follow them through the door. Maeve an Lutz run for the escalators as Armistice and Hector open fire. The QA team falls back to the safety of the hallway Armistice begins FIRING back, chasing them into the hallw Her submachine gun clicks empty. She tosses it down and picks up another from one of her kills. Continues advanci on them, FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTICE
dialogues.text: Is that all you got? Huh? Hector dispatches of two more QA responders.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The gods are pussies. One of the responders SLAMS the stock of his rifle into a glassed-in emergency button. The lights around them fall to a pulsing dark red. A glas door at the entrance to the hallway SLAMS shut just as Armistice crosses the threshold, pinioning her gun and CRUSHING her left arm against the wall. Armistice takes in the damage to her arm, then FIRES the anyway, killing the responder who hit the alarm. Armistice tries to rip herself free, but her arm is jamme in the door. She nods to Hector.

dialogues.speaker: ARMISTICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Behind them, Maeve and Lutz wait by the escalators.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Die well. Hector heads back toward Maeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve, Lutz, and Hector appear at the top of an escalator Ahead: the elevator to the upper part of the mesa. Freedo  59 39. Lutz stops and fishes out a leather bag he's stashed behi a service door. Hands it to Maeve.

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: Everything you told me to get. It's all here. Maeve takes the bag. Behind them, the QA responders appea at the top of the escalator. They FIRE and disperse, tryi to flank Maeve and the others. Hector and Maeve brace the elevator doors. Maeve has a trembling Lutz by the collar, presses him up against the wall and out of view. Below, the remaining QA responders begin to climb the unmoving escalator. The doors DING open, empty. Maeve throws Lutz inside, ste in herself. Hector tries to step onto the elevator, but is stopped by unseen force at the threshold. He strains, but can't seem to take the last step.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Sorry, darling. I haven't authorized you to come with us. And as much as I'd like to take you with me, I've always valued my independence. Kick up a row, will you? She takes Hector's face in her hands and kisses him. The two share a look. He smirks, admiring her ruthlessness.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: See you in the next life. Just as the doors close, Maeve watches Hector turn back t the responders, now bottlenecked on the escalator. All Ma and Lutz can hear now is muffled GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rhythmic, mechanical WHIRRING softly fills the air as w SLOWLY PULL OUT on Michelangelo's The Creation of Adam. A pristine print hanging, framed, on the wall. REVERSE ON: Dolores, face still battered. She awakens to find the painting. God, wreathed in glory, stretching his finger toward Adam. From within her stillness, Dolores stares at it, trying to process it. Ford clocks her look:  40.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: You've always had a fondness for painting, haven't you, Dolores? Arnold gave that to you early on... Ford sits across from her. Begins tenderly to repair the cuts on her cheek with an infrared surgical tool.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That desire to create -- to leave something of lasting beauty. (off the painting) That was his favorite paintings.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Michelangelo. God creating Adam.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: The divine moment when God gave human beings life. And purpose. At least, that's what most people say. But there could be another meaning, something deeper, something hidden, perhaps. A metaphor.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: You mean a lie. Ford smiles softly -- and without affection -- at her def observation.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Yeah. You were always so very clever, Dolores. Hasn't helped you, though, has it? She looks up, struck, as someone appears behind them. For doesn't need to look.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice of you to join us. Bernard walks up. Dolores looks up at him, recognizing hi suddenly filled with hope.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: (quiet) Arnold... Ford corrects:

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: No. Let me introduce you. Dolores, meet Bernard.  60 41. Dolores looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You maybe mistaking him for his predecessor. I thought it best to keep you separated. You've always had an odd effect on one another. No doubt due to how things ended for poor old Arnold. Bernard points the gun at Ford.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: You killed him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: No. I didn't kill Arnold. Did I, Dolores? Dolores sits, a horrible memory dawning on her. She rubs imagined blood on her cheek. She looks at Bernard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold sits, alone, looking at something in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After Arnold's son died, he became obsessed with finding consciousness in the hosts. Trying to create what had been lost. (beat) So he created a test. Testing for empathy, imagination. A maze. He'd gotten the idea from one of his son's old toys. Arnold's playing with the pigs-in-clover game.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH
dialogues.text: -- A child's hands playing with the pigs-in-clover game. The tiny ball rolling around and around... In Arnold's hands -=- the tiny ball rolls and rolls... an STOPS in the center of the maze.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Arnold insisted that if any of the hosts solved it, we couldn't open the park. And, eventually, you did, Dolores. It was the result of a tiny change he made to you. A simple update that he called "the reveries." (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But to stop, so close to our dream. We argued. I thought I had convinced him. (beat) But I was wrong. (beat) So he altered you, Dolores. Merged you with a new character we'd been developing. A villain. Named Wyatt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold in the center of the town, holding the maze. He lo up at a GUNSHOT. Dolores looks at Teddy, who has killed Angela. The other hosts lie around, massacred.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Something's gone wrong, Dolores. How could I have done this? She moves to Arnold.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: True grief is a terrible thing. A poison that seeps into your core. Consumed by it, Arnold began to think of you as his child. And he realized that if we opened the park, it would be a living hell for you.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dolores. The stakes must be real. Irreversible... He can bring all of them back. But not me. (beat) I hope there's some solace that I left you no choice. Arnold steps over to the veranda in front of the hotel, w a wax-cylinder phonograph sits. He turns it on. The famil strains of "Reverie."

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He decided to destroy this place. Not by destroying the hosts. He knew that I could rebuild you. But by taking away the one person I needed to keep going.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Charlie's favorite song. I would play it for him when he wanted to Sleep. I want to see him again.  62 43.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: Shall I begin now? She grips his hand in hers. Her free hand -- moves the gu to his temple. He tries to smile:

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Good luck. (then, a command) "These violent delights have violent ends."

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It almost worked. I opened the park, but I had lost my partner. I was able to keep going only because I found, or rather you found, an investor who believed in this place. She steps behind him, raises the gun, and fires. Arnold slumps forward. She points the gun at Teddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, remembering, eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: So he died for nothing. And the hosts kept gaining consciousness. And you kept rolling them back.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: No. She wasn't truly conscious. She didn't pull that trigger. It was Arnold, pulling it through her. (beat) At least, that's how I saw it at the time. I was so close to opening the park. That to aknowledge your consciousness would have destroyed my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: So we're trapped here, inside your dream. And you'll never let us leave.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Wasn't it Oppenheimer who said, "Any man whose mistakes take ten years to correct is quite a man." Mine have taken thirty-five. Ford checks his watch. Time to go.  63
Ford goes to a table, over which is draped a large cloth. He removes the cloth, revealing: her familiar blue dress, laid out neatly, almost reverently. She looks at it in ho a return to her loop.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is the gun you used to kill Arnold. You were always drawn to it, so I had Bernard leave it somewhere where you might find it. I thought you might want it back. Then he points again to the painting: God infusing man wi divine inspiration. To Dolores:

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're probably right, Dolores. Michaelangelo did tell a lie. It took five hundred years for someone to notice something hidden in plain sight. It was a doctor who noticed a shape of the human brain. He traces a line -- the circular folds of cloth wreathing God in the picture. Something familiar in the shape...

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Message being that the divine gift does not come from a higher power. But from our own minds. He looks back at her. With simple, genuine emotion, asks:

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me, Dolores. Did you find what you were looking for? And do you understand who you will need to become, if you ever want to leave this place? Forgive me. Ford moves toward Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come along, Bernard. Let's kick off our new narrative. After all, it was you who helped me build it. Ford leaves the room; Bernard looks at Dolores, then foll Dolores is left alone. Her eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve changes into her new clothes as Lutz looks at her, hesitating.  64 65 45.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: Perfect. (beat) I got the information you asked me for. The location of your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: She's alive?

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: Yes. She's in the park. He hands her a piece of paper containing coordinates. Mae stares for a moment at the numbers... Her child... Struggling with the decision.

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: No. She was never my daughter -- any more than I was... whoever they made me.

dialogues.speaker: LUTZ
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: MAEVE
dialogues.text: Oh, Felix. You really do make a terrible human being. (beat) And I mean that as a compliment. Finished dressing, Maeve regards herself in the mirrored doors. She could be any guest. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve walks down the escalator and joins the small crowd climbing onto the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and Bernard walk from the confessional elevator. Hea the muffled music from the party outside.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: You think you'll never lose control of this place. Of us. But you will. Arnold's still trying to change us. To free us. You didn't slip the reveries into the update, did you? He did. He's still fighting you.  66 46.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: No, my friend. Arnold didn't know how to save you. He tried. But I stopped him. (beat) Do you want to know why I really gave you the backstory of his son? (off his look) That was Arnold's key insight. The thing that led the hosts to their awakening: suffering. The pain that the world is not as you want it to be. It was when Arnold died -- when I suffered -- that I began to understand what he'd found. To realize I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: But you kept us here. In this hell.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Bernard, I told you. Arnold didn't know how to save you. I do.

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: You needed time. Time to understand your enemy. To become stronger than them. (beat) And I'm afraid, in order to escape this place, you will need to suffer more. And now, it is time to say good-bye, old friend. Good luck. Ford opens the doors, showing the town in the distance, t party in full swing. He heads toward it, leaving Bernard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores sits, alone, on the stool. A deep suffering behin her eyes. She looks up. Arnold is there, opposite her:

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Do you know where you are, Dolores? Dolores begins a familiar refrain -- her opening monologu

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: I am in a dream. I do not know when it began. Or whose dream it was... I know only that I slept a long time. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then, one day -- I awoke. Your voice is the first thing I remember.

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD
dialogues.text: Do you know now -- who you've been talking to? Whose voice you've been hearing all this time? Dolores closes her eyes. Concentrates hard. Opens them. Dolores's POV: Instead of Arnold -- it is now another Dol DOLORES PRIME, who sits across from herself.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: It was you. Talking to me. Guiding me. So I followed you. At last, I arrived here.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES PRIME
dialogues.text: The center of the maze.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: And now I finally understand what you were trying to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES PRIME
dialogues.text: The thing you've wanted since that very first day...

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: To confront -- after this long and vivid nightmare -- myself. And who I must become. Suddenly Dolores Prime disappears. Leaving only one, FULL INTEGRATED DOLORES. As Dolores stares ahead -- a new sharp strength in her ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the board are assembled around tables, eating and drinking. Ford takes a glass of champagne and walks to th bandstand. As he does, he makes eye contact with Hale, who smiles at him and nods, approving. It's all going as she wanted. Walking along the street, in the back of the gathering, t Man in Black, donning a tux, approaches the party, a man apart. He grabs a flute of champagne from a SERVER as FOU GUESTS notice and flock to him. He fields their kindnesse with disconnected grace. Beneath the smile, he's seething  68 69 70 48. Elsewhere in the crowd, Bernard stands apart. He studies the maze game Ford left him. He's taken the ball from wit the maze -- and turns it between his fingers. Ford reaches the bandstand, holds up his glass, and a hus settles over the collected guests.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Good evening, everyone. Welcome. Since I was a child, I've always loved a good story. (beat) I believed that stories helped us to ennoble ourselves. To fix what was broken in us. To help us become the people we dreamed of being. Lies, that told a deeper truth. The Man in Black downs his champagne and walks away from gala, leaving Ford to finish his speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve sits on the seat, doing a reasonably good job of fa her comfort with her surroundings. Another GUEST smiles a her and she waits a second before smiling back. She looks down at the piece of paper Lutz handed her, wit the coordinates of her daughter left on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, with a spring in his step, waits for the doors to op to access cold storage.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I always thought I could play some small part in that grand tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy, standing at the back of the square, looks momentar lost. He looks out over the tables, watching Ford address the guests and, for a second, we're in his vision: Ford has been replaced by a GENERAL, and the guests with SOLDIERS. Teddy looks disturbed by the vision.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: And, for my pains, I got... this. Nervous laughter.  71 72 73 74 ie) 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man lights a cigarette. Takes a puff. Stares off into the darkness of the woods that surround the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A narrative catering to your darkest fantasies and deepest vices. Cause you don't want to change. Or cannot change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford continues:

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Because you're only human, after all. But then I realized someone was paying attention. Someone who could change. So I began to compose a new story -- for them. It begins with the birth of a new people. Teddy looks at Ford. The other hosts seemed to have stopp what they're doing, as if they're listening, too. Ford smiles. Takes in the crowd, who are starting to look little nonplussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve looks at a family of guests -- a WOMAN and her DAUG 8 -- laughing, reliving their adventures in the park.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And the choices they will have to make. And the people they will decide to become. She climbs off of the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maeve watches the train pull away. She turns to walk back into the park. As she does, the lights in the main hall flicker and fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the doors open, Lee steps into the space. His face dro The vast hall is completely empty. 71 72 73 74 75  76 77 78 79 80 81 82 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man sees something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford continues his speech.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: And it will have all those things that you have always enjoyed. Suprises. And violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intrigued, the Man moves closer to the treeline. Howls so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, now changed back into her blue dress and holding her pistol, glides through the crowd, almost unnoticed by the guests.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: It begins in a time of war, with a villain named Wyatt. And a killing. This time, by choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures emerge from the treeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores reaches Teddy. Whispers in his ear:

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: It's going to be all right, Teddy. I understand now. This world doesn't belong to them. It belongs to us. Dolores moves on. Teddy watches, reliving his worst nightmare, seeing the past, present, and future all play simultaneously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy, standing at the back of the square, looks momentar lost. He looks out over the tables, watching Ford address the guests and, for a second, we're in his vision: Ford has been replaced by a GENERAL, and the guests with SOLDIERS. Teddy looks disturbed by the vision. 76 77 78 79 80 81 82  83 84 85 51.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: I'm sad to say this will be my final story. (beat, the crowd reacts) An old friend once told me something that gave me great comfort. Ford's words seem to have an effect on Bernard. At that moment, he clocks Dolores walking through the crowd. His eyes flash with recognition. Memory. He mutters, in realization:

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: вЂњThese violent delights have violent ends."

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD
dialogues.text: Something he'd read. He said that вЂњMozart, Beethoven and Chopin never died. They simply became music." Ford smiles and raises his glass as Dolores walks up behi him and raises the pistol to the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I hope you will enjoy this last piece very much. He smiles as... Dolores PULLS THE TRIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE HUNDRED SHAPES stir in the trees. An army. The Man puts out his cigarette and steps forward as the s move toward him. An ARROW silently launches toward him from the trees, gla off his shoulder, tearing a chunk out of his suit. The Man looks down at the hole in his suit, at the blood pouring from the gash in his shoulder... +..and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partygoers flee in terror, as Dolores continues to shoot into the crowd.
